definition: slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
plan/strategy/outline/summary/slightly/rather/to rob/to plunder/to summarize/to omit
variant of 略[lu:e4]
to know/to be aware
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid

sentences.english: We know other things about their lives as well.
sentences.chinese: 我们还对他们生活的其他方面略知一二。

sentences.english: I lived in Yokohama two summers ago, so I know a little about it.
sentences.chinese: 我两年前的夏天在横滨住过，所以我略知一二。

sentences.english: He had by now an inkling of the factors involved.
sentences.chinese: 他总算对涉及到的各种因素略知一二了。

sentences.english: The Japanese know a thing or two about natural disasters.
sentences.chinese: 日本人对自然灾害还是略知一二的。

sentences.english: Bing knows a thing or two about survival–and about resurrection.
sentences.chinese: 宾对生存和复兴略知一二。

sentences.english: To my joy, my son knows a thing or two about Italian.
sentences.chinese: 使我高兴的是，我儿子对义大利语也略知一二。

sentences.english: As a profe or of renewable energy, he already knew about the technology.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名可再生能源教授，他对这项技术略知一二。

sentences.english: And Billups knows a thing or two about championship defense.
sentences.chinese: 同时比卢普斯也对总决赛的防守也略知一二。

sentences.english: The doves, perching always on the eaves of the Stone Chapel (King's Chapel) opposite, may know something about it.
sentences.chinese: 常在对面王国教堂檐下栖息的鸽子也许略知一二。

sentences.english: My name is Jester , and I know a thingortwo about this place.
sentences.chinese: 我的名字是杰斯特，关于这座建筑略知一二。

sentences.english: Carpenter: I don’t dare say that I have.
sentences.chinese: 木匠:我不敢说做过，只不过对此略知一二。

definition: slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
to hear of/to hear about
pretty close/very near/about right
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
to find out about/to discover
to know what's going on
to know/to understand
one or two/a few
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
to know sth fluently/well-versed
to be well aware
